## Teaching assistant

### Advanced econometrics (2021), M1 Master of Economics, Université Paris-Saclay
Teaching assistant for Hugo Molina, Julien Monardo and Margherita Comola in the first year of the [Master of Economics](https://www.universite-paris-saclay.fr/formation/master/economie/m1-economics#programme). Practical econometric classes on the basic techniques of non-linear econometrics (including nonlinear least squares, maximum likelihood estimator, discrete choice models, sample selection models) and recent developments in the microeconomic analysis of impact evaluation (including randomized controlled experiments, instrumental variables, matching methods, regression discontinuity and difference-in-differences).[Link to syllabus](https://www.dropbox.com/s/h7g93zrn1c74s5s/TutorialsProgram.pdf?dl=0)

### Econometrics (2017-2021), L3 Economie, ENS Paris-Saclay
Teaching assistant for Jean-Christophe Tavanti in the Social Science Department at [ENS Paris-Saclay ](https://ens-paris-saclay.fr/en/education/departments/human-and-social-sciences-shs-department). Linear econometrics and ordinary least squares estimator (algebraic properties, geometric properties, and inferential properties). Practical classes, to train students practice of econometrics using R and STATA, supervising a short piece of research in data analysis/econometrics. [Link to problem sets](https://www.dropbox.com/s/0eyha8ubr7fxaot/brochure_tds.pdf?dl=0) [Link to syllabus](https://www.dropbox.com/s/ixu8w4q1g5a590y/prog_TDs_R.pdf?dl=0)
